messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/29/2003 10:21:16 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
unolist@... writes:


> How does this raffle work? The reason I ask is because we have
> had "chinese auctions" around these parts and they are always great
> fun. You only put your raffle tickets in the cup for the item you
> want to bid on. Increases you chances, and leaves out the possibility
> of winning something you were never interested in.

That's what we do. Didn't know it had a "name".

~Kelly

messages.subject: Re: raffle
messages.msgSnippet: How does this raffle work? The reason I ask is because we have had chinese auctions around these parts and they are always great fun. You only put your
messages.messageBody:
How does this raffle work? The reason I ask is because we have
had "chinese auctions" around these parts and they are always great
fun. You only put your raffle tickets in the cup for the item you
want to bid on. Increases you chances, and leaves out the possibility
of winning something you were never interested in.

Ang, being nosey

messages.messageBody:
At 09:36 2/15/03 -0500, Kelly wrote:
>It's a raffle to help fund the Live & Learn Unschooling Conference in SC.
>Items must NOT be "educational"---'cause EVERYTHING is educational! Fun
>things, cool things, different things, handmade things, found things, books,
>artwork, gift certificates, games---everything counts! <G> We had some really
>neat things last year!

Tell me about it! I won so many things, including a GORGEOUS felted hat
that I absolutely LOVE! I just can't wait until this year, and this time
I'll bring some stuff to donate, too. I love the pottery idea.

Love,

Marji

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] raffle
messages.msgSnippet: Okay, I have to run out now.9 degrees!! Anyway, here s my link..check it out. www.coyotescorner.com  We don t have everything
messages.messageBody:
Okay,
I have to run out now.9 degrees!!
Anyway, here's my link..check it out.

www.coyotescorner.com <http://www.coyotescorner.com/>
We don't have everything here. We're adding stuff all the time.

Please send suggestions.
Maybe we can make the conference. That would be very cool!!
Janis

-----Original Message-----
From: kbcdlovejo@... [mailto:kbcdlovejo@...]
Sent: Saturday, February 15, 2003 9:37 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] raffle

In a message dated 2/15/2003 7:59:54 AM Eastern Standard Time,
jana@... writes:


> Hi,
> I don't know what y'all are talking about, but I often contribute.
> I have an on-line store.
>
> We're adding to it. Some of the items will be about Homeschool and
unschool

It's a raffle to help fund the Live & Learn Unschooling Conference in SC.
Items must NOT be "educational"---'cause EVERYTHING is educational! Fun
things, cool things, different things, handmade things, found things, books,
artwork, gift certificates, games---everything counts! <G> We had some
really
neat things last year!

Send to

SOS 118 Steeplechase South
Columbia, SC 29209-4810

Or bring it yourself to the conference!

Thanks!

~Kelly

It's a raffle to help fund the Live & Learn Unschooling Conference in SC.
Items must NOT be "educational"---'cause EVERYTHING is educational! Fun
things, cool things, different things, handmade things, found things, books,
artwork, gift certificates, games---everything counts! <G> We had some really
